normalize_lonlat(lon, lat)[source]¶

Return the given location represented within the coordinate scheme of the current heatmap (e.g. [-180, 180] vs [0, 360]). If the location isn’t part of the current heatmap, its representation is undefined.

plot Module¶

sigvisa.plotting.plot.autowrap_text(textobj, renderer)[source]¶

Wraps the given matplotlib text object so that it exceed the boundaries of the axis it is plotted in.

sigvisa.plotting.plot.min_dist_inside(point, rotation, box)[source]¶

Gets the space in a given direction from “point” to the boundaries of “box” (where box is an object with x0, y0, x1, & y1 attributes, point is a tuple of x,y, and rotation is the angle in degrees)

sigvisa.plotting.plot.on_draw(event)[source]¶

Auto-wraps all text objects in a figure at draw-time
